page.title: 13Thornton Parish
page.content: A total of 85 people regularly attend the 3 services each Sunday and 45 children come to Sunday School. The congregation consists mainly of the elderly. There are 11 people in choir, including two young girls but no boys.Reverend Clements regards the church as the heart of the community, and he believes that it is society, rather than the church, which is changing. He would like the congregation to include people of all ages. He enjoys a rural parish because the community is close-knit. The disadvantages are that people can be rather narrow-minded, gossipy and reluctant to accept change.
